title: Seeing a sound
creator_contributor_role: Victoria. Ministry of Education, production company
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Speech therapy for children
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Language experience approach in education

Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Speech therapy for children
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Speech therapy for children
description: Jane Passy, a speech therapist, explains how valuable her system of cued articulation can be in primary education in helping children to learn the consonant sounds of the English language. The method involves hand movements to demonstrate the physical actions of speech.
